intro: Caladenia erythronema, commonly known as the red-stemmed spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a terrestrial orchid with a single, erect stem that bears a single, showy pink or red flower. The plant has a fibrous root system and is adapted to grow in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are typically 5–7 cm in length and have a distinctive spider-like appearance. Caladenia erythronema is listed as vulnerable due to habitat loss and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands.
